titleInfo.title: Letterhead from the St. Louis Council of the National Council of Negro Women, Inc., circa 1950

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Letterhead from the St. Louis Council of the National Council of Negro Women, Inc. Noted on the letterhead is "Affiliated with The National Council of Women of the United States and International Council of Women of the World." On the left hand side of the letterhead are the names of the organization's leadership. This letterhead is attributed to Maggie Adams White. Maggie Adams White (1882-1980) was a milliner and an active Republican in St. Louis, Missouri. She was born in South Carolina in 1882 to Young Adams, who was born into slavery. She went to St. James CME in Collierville, Tennessee and after moving to St. Louis, Missouri became a founding member of Scruggs CME. She was a member of the NAACP and entrenched in local politics. She died in December 1980.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
